page.title: 16Lifestyles in Maenan
page.content: This eastern side of the area is a region where deteriorating services cause anxiety about the survival of the existing scattered community. Few houses have main services - most rely on wells or streams, and septic tanks are universal.Cars are a necessity as buses are infrequent and seasonal, though a special bus conveys children to school. There is fierce resistance to threatened closure of the primary school,which teaches through the medium of Welsh,spoken locally. The school is the main focus of local activities, such as whist drives and the May Day Rose Queen festival. There is no local policeman, the nearest being in Llanrwst, and there is only one public telephone in this locality.
